skill.name: deep-reading-analyst
skill.description: Comprehensive framework for deep analysis of articles, papers, and long-form content using 10+ thinking models (SCQA, 5W2H, critical thinking, inversion, mental models, first principles, systems thinking, six thinking hats). Use when users want to: (1) deeply understand complex articles/content, (2) analyze arguments and identify logical flaws, (3) extract actionable insights from reading materials, (4) create study notes or learning summaries, (5) compare multiple sources, (6) transform knowledge into practical applications, or (7) apply specific thinking frameworks. Triggered by phrases like 'analyze this article,' 'help me understand,' 'deep dive into,' 'extract insights from,' 'use [framework name],' or when users provide URLs/long-form content for analysis.
skill.summary: Comprehensive framework for deep analysis of articles, papers, and long-form content using 10+ think...
skill.author: YYH211

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and analysis frameworks. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Contains instructional content for 10+ thinking frameworks with templates and guidance.

content.value_statement: Transform surface-level reading into deep understanding. Apply proven thinking models to extract insights, evaluate arguments, and turn reading into actionable knowledge.
actual_capabilities: Applies 10+ thinking frameworks (SCQA, 5W2H, Critical Thinking, Inversion, Mental Models, First Principles, Systems Thinking, Six Thinking Hats)
Creates structured analysis outputs with templates for learning notes, argument analysis, and decision frameworks
Evaluates argument quality and identifies logical flaws using evidence evaluation matrices
Synthesizes insights from multiple sources through cross-comparison matrices
Maps causal relationships and feedback loops using systems thinking techniques
Generates actionable takeaways and application plans from reading materials
limitations: Does not access external URLs or fetch content from the web
Relies on user-provided content for analysis
Quality of output depends on clarity and completeness of input material
Does not provide domain-specific expertise beyond framework application

use_cases.title: Academic paper analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze research papers to extract core claims, evaluate evidence quality, and identify logical gaps.

use_cases.title: Business document review
use_cases.description: Evaluate business articles, reports, and strategy documents using SCQA and inversion thinking.

use_cases.title: Self-directed learning
use_cases.description: Transform blog posts, articles, and books into structured learning notes with actionable insights.

prompt_templates.title: Quick analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this article using SCQA framework. Extract the Situation, Complication, Question, and Answer. Identify the top 3 key insights.

prompt_templates.title: Critical evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply critical thinking framework to this content. Assess argument strength, identify logical fallacies, and evaluate evidence quality.

prompt_templates.title: Deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a deep analysis using First Principles, Mental Models, and Systems Thinking. Rebuild from fundamentals and map feedback loops.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-source
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare these three articles on the same topic using the comparison matrix. Identify consensus, divergence, and synthesize an integrated view.

output_examples.input: Analyze this article about remote work productivity using SCQA and critical thinking.
output: **SCQA Analysis**: Situation (remote work tech maturity), Complication (productivity monitoring challenges), Question (how to maintain output?), Answer (async communication + outcome metrics)
**Critical Evaluation**: Strong on solutions, weak on mental health considerations
**Top 3 Insights**: 1) Shift from time-based to outcome-based evaluation, 2) Documentation becomes critical, 3) Overcommunication prevents isolation

best_practices: Start with quick frameworks (SCQA, 5W2H) before moving to deeper analysis
Apply inversion thinking to identify hidden risks and missing assumptions
Always generate concrete action items tied to specific timeframes
Use multiple mental models from different disciplines for robust conclusions
anti_patterns: Applying all frameworks at once without considering depth level
Using frameworks superficially without genuine insight extraction
Copying text verbatim instead of rephrasing for understanding
Skipping the action planning phase after analysis

faq.question: Which frameworks work best for business articles?
faq.answer: SCQA + Mental Models (economics lens) + Inversion work well for strategy and business content.

faq.question: How long does each analysis level take?
faq.answer: Quick (15 min), Standard (30 min), Deep (60 min), Research (120+ min with web search).

faq.question: Can this analyze content from URLs?
faq.answer: The skill provides frameworks. For URL content, use web_fetch or provide the text directly to analyze.

faq.question: Is my data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No data storage or sharing. All analysis happens in-session based on provided content.

faq.question: What if content lacks sufficient information?
faq.answer: The 5W2H framework explicitly identifies information gaps and missing pieces for follow-up.

faq.question: How is this different from general summarization?
faq.answer: Uses structured thinking frameworks for deeper analysis, not just summarization. Evaluates quality, identifies flaws, and generates application plans.
